model.weapon

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.weapon.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class representing the weapon element. It's composed of effects that will be executed according to user decisions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private transient java.util.logging.Logger logger

      • baseEffect

        private Effect baseEffect
        Effect representing the base effect of the weapon. It's always != null, and it always has not a cost (cost 0,0,0). It can be used without specific conditions.

      • alternativeEffect

        private Effect alternativeEffect
        Effect representing the alternative effect of the weapon. Either the base effect or the alternative effect can be used, both is forbidden. Can be null. Cost can be != 0.

      • optionalEffect

        private java.util.List<Effect> optionalEffect
        ArrayList of Effect representing the list of optional effects of the weapon. Except for movement only effects, they can be used only using the base effect too. Can be null. Cost can be != 0. It's empty when weapon has only a base effect or an alternative effect

      • typeEffect

        private int typeEffect
        Integer representing the kind of weapon: 0 normal, 1 optional, 2 alternative

      • partiallyLoadedCost

        private Ammo partiallyLoadedCost
        Ammo represeting the cost of a partially loaded weapon. When picked up this is the cost of what to be payed

      • reloadCost

        private Ammo reloadCost
        Ammo represeting the color of the weapon It's always just one ammo color cube. Reaload cost + partiallyLoadedCost = cost of a fully charge. To be paid to reload after shooting

      • idName

        private java.lang.String idName
        String representing the name of the weapon

      • loaded

        private LoadedState loaded
        Integer representing the state of the weapon: 0 weapon unloaded, 1 partially loaded, 2 fully loaded

    • Constructor Detail

      • Weapon

        public Weapon()
        Empty constructor

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(Effect baseEffect,
              Effect alternativeEffect,
              java.util.List<Effect> optionalEffect,
              int typeEffect,
              Ammo partiallyLoadedCost,
              Ammo reloadCost,
              java.lang.String idName,
              LoadedState loaded)
        Constructor for a new weapon giving all the parameters.Builds a weapon with either alternative effect or optional effects
        Parameters:
        baseEffect - the Effect which represent the normal use of a weapon. Can not be null.
        alternativeEffect - the Effect which represent, if != null, the alternative effect of the weapon.
        optionalEffect - the ArrayList of Effect which represent the list of all the optional effects of the weapon.
        typeEffect - the Integer representing the kind of weapon.
        partiallyLoadedCost - the Ammo representing the cost of a partially loaded weapon. To be paid to pick it up.
        reloadCost - the Ammo representing the color of the weapon. partiallyLoadedCost + reloadCost = ammos to be paid for a full charge.
        idName - the String representing the name of the weapon
        loaded - the Integer representing the state of the weapon

      • Weapon

        public Weapon(int typeEffect,
              Ammo partiallyLoadedCost,
              Ammo reloadCost,
              java.lang.String idName,
              LoadedState loaded)
        Constructor for a new weapon giving some of the parameters.
        Parameters:
        typeEffect - the Integer representing the kind of weapon.
        partiallyLoadedCost - the Ammo representing the cost of a partially loaded weapon. To be paid to pick up it.
        reloadCost - the Ammo representing the color of the weapon. partiallyLoadedCost + reloadCost = ammos to be paid for a full charge.
        idName - the String representing the name of the weapon
        loaded - the Integer representing the state of the weapon

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(Player actingPlayer,
                       GameManager gameManager)
        this weapon checks if there's a possible path using the effects in which the player can actually shoot the onlyMovement effects are simulated to achieve the right answer anytime
        Parameters:
        actingPlayer: - the player that has the weapon
        gameManager: - the general structure of the game
        Returns:
        true if it's possible to shoot with this weapon, false otherwise

      • getPossibleTypeOfEffects

        public java.util.List<TypeOfEffect> getPossibleTypeOfEffects(GameManager gameManager,
                                                             Player p)
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current Game
        p - the current player
        Returns:
        the List of Type of Effects tha can be chosen

      • beforeBaseEffect

        public void beforeBaseEffect(GameManager gameManager,
                             Player player)
        this method is called when the player selects a weapon to shoot. It checks if there are more types of effects available. If only base or alternative are available it will automatically proceed to start the one that is possible. If only Optional effects are available then the effect has to chosen by the player. If more then 1 type of effect is available then the type to be used has to be chosen by the player
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player

      • isAValidTypeOfEffect

        public TypeOfEffect isAValidTypeOfEffect(TypeOfEffect typeOfEffect,
                                         GameManager gameManager,
                                         Player player)
                                  throws GameException
        Parameters:
        typeOfEffect - the typeOfEffect chosen by the user
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player
        Returns:
        true if the effect is selectable
        Throws:
        GameException - thrown if the effect is not one of the selectable

                                    Player p)
        method used to notify the client about what optional effect he wants to use
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current Game
        p - the player to be notified

      • baseEffectExecute

        public void baseEffectExecute(GameManager gameManager,
                              Player player)
        this method initializes all the structure in CurrentTurn that are used in the effect computation. Then it starts the base effect computation
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player

      • alternativeEffectExecute

        public void alternativeEffectExecute(GameManager gameManager,
                                     Player player)
        this method initializes all the structure in CurrentTurn that are used in the effect computation. Then it starts the alternative effect computation
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player

      • afterEffect

        public void afterEffect(Effect e,
                        GameManager gameManager,
                        Player player)
        method called after the complete execution of an effect if no more effects are available, it will automatically proceed to end the shooting action. if some effects are available, then it will notify the client to choose the next effect
        Parameters:
        e - the effect that has been completed
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player

      • isAValidEffect

        public boolean isAValidEffect(Effect effect,
                              GameManager gameManager,
                              Player player)
        this effect returns true if it has at least one possible target. Returns true also if it's an only movement effect and has a position in which the Base Effect can be executed
        Parameters:
        effect - the effect to be analysed
        gameManager - the current Game
        player - the current Player
        Returns:
        true if it's possible to use the effect, false otherwise

      • clear

        public void clear(GameManager gameManager,
                  Player currentPlayer)
        this method sets all the Weapon and Effect for a new use. Clears the current Turn in GameManager
        Parameters:
        gameManager - the current game
        currentPlayer - the current Player
